q: Words are clothes that thoughts wear
h:
“Words are clothes that thoughts wear” —
Samuel Butler

q: Life is the art of drawing sufficient conclusions from insufficient premises.
h:
“Life is the art of drawing sufficient conclusions from insufficient premises.” —
Samuel Butler

q: Every man's work, whether it be literature or music or pictures or architecture or anything else, is always a portrait of himself.
h:
“Every man's work, whether it be literature or music or pictures or architecture or anything else, is always a portrait of himself.” —
Samuel Butler

q: Logic is like the sword - those who appeal to it shall perish by it.
h:
“Logic is like the sword - those who appeal to it shall perish by it.” —
Samuel Butler
